meanings.definition: A plant of the daisy family with yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The butterweed in the garden brightened up the whole yard.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often see butterweed growing alongside the road.
meanings.sent3: The butterweed told the daisies jokes to make them bloom faster.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of butterweed, a sunny carpet under the sky.
meanings.sent5: The butterweed's yellow petals danced in the breeze, like little suns on stems.

meanings.definition: A weed that grows in fields and pastures.
meanings.sent1: The cows avoided the butterweed while grazing in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to pull out the butterweed to protect his crops.
meanings.sent3: The butterweed played hide-and-seek with the other plants in the field.
meanings.sent4: The butterweed spread like wildfire, claiming every inch of the pasture.
meanings.sent5: The butterweed's presence in the field was as unwelcome as a storm on a sunny day.
